org.springdata.cassandra.cql.spec
Class TableSpecification<T extends WithOptionsSpecification<TableOption,T>>

java.lang.Object
  org.springdata.cassandra.cql.spec.WithNameSpecification<T>
      org.springdata.cassandra.cql.spec.WithOptionsSpecification<TableOption,T>
          org.springdata.cassandra.cql.spec.TableSpecification<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
TableDescriptor
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreateTableSpecification, DefaultTableDescriptor
public class TableSpecification<T extends WithOptionsSpecification<TableOption,T>>
extends WithOptionsSpecification<TableOption,T>
implements TableDescriptor

Builder class to support the construction of table specifications that have columns. This class can also be used as a standalone TableDescriptor, independent of CreateTableSpecification.

Author:
Matthew T. Adams, Alex Shvid

public T column(String name,
                com.datastax.driver.core.DataType type)
Adds the given non-key column to the table.

Parameters:
name - The column name; must be a valid unquoted or quoted identifier without the surrounding double quotes.
type - The data type of the column.

clusteringKeyColumn

public T clusteringKeyColumn(String name,
                             com.datastax.driver.core.DataType type,
                             Ordering ordering)
Adds the given primary key column to the table with the given ordering (null meaning ascending).

Parameters:
name - The column name; must be a valid unquoted or quoted identifier without the surrounding double quotes.
type - The data type of the column.
ordering - If the given KeyPart is KeyPart.CLUSTERING, then the given ordering is used, else ignored.
Returns:
this

column

protected T column(String name,
                   com.datastax.driver.core.DataType type,
                   KeyPart keyPart,
                   Ordering ordering)
Adds the given info as a new column to the table.

Parameters:
name - The column name; must be a valid unquoted or quoted identifier without the surrounding double quotes.
type - The data type of the column.
keyPart - Indicates key type. Null means that the column is not a key column.
ordering - If the given KeyPart is KeyPart.CLUSTERING, then the given ordering is used, else ignored.
Returns:
this

getAllColumns

public List<ColumnSpecification> getAllColumns()
Returns an unmodifiable list of all columns. Order is important: partition key columns, clustering key columns, non key columns

Specified by:
getAllColumns in interface TableDescriptor

getPartitionKeyColumns

public List<ColumnSpecification> getPartitionKeyColumns()
Returns an unmodifiable list of all partition key columns.

Specified by:
getPartitionKeyColumns in interface TableDescriptor

getClusteringKeyColumns

public List<ColumnSpecification> getClusteringKeyColumns()
Returns an unmodifiable list of all primary key columns that are not also partition key columns.
